macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Explosive Start to 2026: Dow Leads Everything Rally in North American Session
items.summary: US stock indexes surged on January 5, 2026, with the Dow Jones leading gains amid a broad 'Everything Rally'; commodities like silver and platinum rose over 6%, while the US and Canadian dollars weakened. Traders eye dovish data paving the way for potential Fed rate cuts ahead of Friday's NFP report.[1]

items.title: Bulls Target Early 2026 Momentum After Weak 2025 Finish
items.summary: S&P 500 ended 2025 with a 16% annual gain despite a December loss; upcoming week features key data like ISM indexes, housing starts, JOLTS, and December payrolls, with Fed easing scope uncertain after 2025 rate cuts. Index futures show mixed signals, with Dow near 47,900 support and S&P in 6,820-6,896 range.[2]

items.title: Major Companies Set for Earnings This Week Including Tilray, Applied Digital, and Constellation Brands
items.summary: Several firms including Tilray (TLRY), Applied Digital (APLD), and Constellation Brands (STZ) are scheduled to report earnings during the week of January 6-8, 2026, amid heightened options volatility.[5]

items.title: Pre-Market Earnings Spotlight: Ango (ANGO) Reports on January 6
items.summary: Ango (ANGO) is featured in pre-market earnings for January 6, 2026, with a 2026 P/E ratio of -45.29 versus industry average of 1.70.[4]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Traders Bet on $100,000 Rally to Kick Off 2026
items.summary: Bitcoin traders are showing strong optimism for 2026, with heightened interest in $100,000 call options on Deribit, particularly the January contract which is the most popular.

items.title: Tom Lee Predicts New Bitcoin All-Time High by End of January 2026
items.summary: Fundstrat's Tom Lee forecasts Bitcoin reaching a new all-time high by late January 2026, despite expecting volatility throughout the year.

items.title: Goldman Sachs: Regulation to Drive Next Institutional Crypto Wave
items.summary: Goldman Sachs anticipates that clearer regulations will fuel the next phase of institutional adoption in cryptocurrencies.

items.title: Congress Stalled on Crypto Market Structure Over DeFi Exemptions
items.summary: U.S. Congress negotiations on digital asset market structure legislation are stalled due to debates over exempting DeFi from investor protection laws, with calls to advance consensus areas for regulatory clarity.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils New AI Models and Rubin Platform for Physical AI at CES 2026
items.summary: NVIDIA launched new open physical AI models, frameworks, and the Rubin platform with six new chips at CES 2026, focusing on reasoning for robotics, autonomous driving, and real-world applications. Global partners unveiled next-generation robots across industries.

items.title: Hyundai Motor Group Announces AI Robotics Strategy and Partners with Google DeepMind
items.summary: Hyundai unveiled its AI Robotics Strategy at CES 2026, emphasizing human-robot collaboration, and Boston Dynamics announced a partnership with Google DeepMind to advance humanoid robot AI models.

items.title: Etron Tech Showcases Edge AI and Robotics Innovations at CES 2026
items.summary: Etron Technology highlighted its MemorAiLink edge AI solutions, including robotics platforms and privacy AI systems like DeCloakBrain, which won CES Innovation Awards, targeting memory, vision sensing, and real-time computing.

items.title: U.S. Army Establishes New AI and Machine Learning Career Path for Officers
items.summary: The U.S. Army created a dedicated AI/ML career field for officers, with initial selections via the Volunteer Transfer Incentive Program starting January 2026 to build in-house expertise.

items.title: Penn State Researchers Use LLMs to Slash Metasurface Design Time to Milliseconds
items.summary: A Penn State team developed an AI method using large language models to predict metasurface-light interactions in seconds, bypassing lengthy simulations and enabling rapid design of nanoscopic materials.

items.title: Qualcomm Completes IE-IoT Expansion for Edge AI Deployment
items.summary: Qualcomm announced the completion of its IE-IoT expansion at CES 2026, unleashing edge AI capabilities for developers, enterprises, and OEMs.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: StarRupture Launches in Early Access Today
items.summary: StarRupture, a PC open-world survival game with industrial base-building on a hostile alien planet, leads this week's releases on January 6, 2026. It follows strong community interest from playtests and emphasizes automation, exploration, and defense.

items.title: Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Debuts at CES 2026 with Major Gaming Boosts
items.summary: Intel launched the first platform built on Intel 18A, featuring Core Ultra Series 3 processors with up to 77% better gaming performance versus Lunar Lake. The processors focus on power efficiency, CPU/GPU improvements, and enhanced AI compute.

items.title: ASUS Reveals AMD 800 Series Motherboards and ROG Strix Coolers at CES
items.summary: ASUS unveiled new AMD 800 series motherboards like the ROG Crosshair X870E Glacial, a CES 2026 Innovation Award winner, with advanced PCIe 5.0 support for high-end gaming and streaming setups.

items.title: Hytale Early Access Launch Set for January 13 After Riot Buyback
items.summary: Hytale, the sandbox game from Hypixel devs backed then canceled by Riot in 2025, returns to PC Early Access on January 13 after the team repurchased rights.

items.title: January 2026 Mobile Games Lineup Packed with Blockbusters
items.summary: Over 25 mobile games launch this month on Android/iOS, including multi-platform hits like Arknights: Endfield on January 22 and The Seven Deadly Sins: Origin on January 28, spanning ARPGs, TCGs, and more.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
